Reviews.Title: “Not a palace”
Reviews.Author: MattP_UK
Reviews.Content: Not a great hotel. Strange smell, basic rooms and medioca Internet access. Bar prices also seem to have gone up when a conference is there. The same beer went up by 50c in one day. Avoid this hotel, there are a lot better in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Left me feeling flat!”
Reviews.Author: LondonRick
Reviews.Content: I attened a conference hosted in the Ergife Palace and from a conference point of view the hotel delivered. They are clearly capable of dealing with large groups but thats about it I'm sorry to say. The hotel is located down a side road and a good 10-15 min cab ride from the center of Rome, the website is great and makes it look very welcoming however the decor is very stark-not in a stylish way more cold and lacking atmosphere. Check-in was easy and the front desk staff were extremely helpful during my stay, a real asset to the hotel, the bar staff on the other hand, surly and slightly rude. Now this could be due to the fact that given there were over 200 of us at this event there was never more than 3 working the bar-the maths just dont work! So to the room, sadly not up to standard. Bed was ok, cleanliness good but I looked out over a car park wall and delivery bay. Now it may be my bad luck but again the noise was just too much, delivery trucks and loud banging at 6am in the morning-not the most relaxing nights sleep. Overall the room felt very dated and small. I guess this place is set up for conferences and can handle large groups well, catering wasn't bad either. I would say though on that basis that if I was staying here for pleasure whilst a conference was on I'd be very dissappointed. It's not a very personal place and overall just doesn't tick the boxes for me. Sorry Ergife, you don't live up to the glamorous website pics!

Reviews.Title: “A conference centre. Full stop.”
Reviews.Author: Daniel E
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ergife as part of a large conference of about 2'000 guests. This was clearly too much for the staff who were struggling to deliver. In retrospect, I am struggling to write a positive review. The strengths of the hotel are that it is fairly newly renovated, it has a nice futuristic lobby and it is equipped to host large events - to a limit. When I checked in, I was given the room of a guest who was already checked in. This was the first time ever that it happened to me. It took them hours to find me a room that was not already occupied. When checked in, I complained about the ventilation and that it was too cold. They then told us that we should have the window open when the sun was out - which is hard when you are attending a conference all day and it is raining out. They were also not supportive in helping us to find restaurant alternatives to those that were in the hotel - which was not very exciting after a couple of tries. They had a clear interest to keep us inside this fairly isolated establishment of a hotel. In addition, service was slow, non-chalant and poor in terms of English. In summary, if you are a tourist you should avoid this hotel. If you are business looking for a place to hold a conference, you could consider it if you get a good offer.

Reviews.Title: “Choose different”
Reviews.Author: grneumann1
Reviews.Content: People at the conference were talking about the bad service and very poor food quality. There was no internet accessability except in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Better than reviews suggest but some problems”
Reviews.Author: MMmd
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two days in February attending a conference. My experience was better than many of the tripadvisor reviews suggest. Both the room and bed were relatively large, it was clean and potentially a very good room. The wireless internet worked in my room but I was the only person among around 20 others I asked that this was the case - for most wired access was needed. In the conference rooms and communal areas the WIFI works very well. Unfortunately my room was let down by some factors that can hopefully be rectified: a) The airconditioning did not work. Rather surprisingly for february the room was too hot and had to be cooled and the only way to do this was to keep the balcony door open. When I turned the air conditioning on to 5C it pumped out out hot air. b) The telephone was not working - A problem when the first time you realise is when you find out that your wake up call did not happen c) The safe was open but in the locked position so could not be used d) The minibar was poorly stocked e) During a shower the bathtub filled with water despite the exit flow being full open. It took 10min for the water to empty. If you are coming for a conference at the hotel, I feel your experience will be good but as a tourist you will probably be better off with a hotel nearer the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Huge conference hotel. Go if you have to.”
Reviews.Author: gravyfancier
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on a number of occasions over several months, sometimes just for a few nights, other times for a week or more. It's a big, impersonal convention hotel. There's a full size outdoor swimming pool open May through September and quite nice bar area nearby. Obviously none of this is available out of season. Bedrooms generally ok although often there's a musty aroma about them or even a quite nasty sewage'y overtone. Nice. Restaurants are big, impersonal, food of very variable quality, from just-about-ok to utterly horrid. As another reviewer has noted, the surrounding area is not great - it's in a fairly urban, zone-in-transition kind of area and best not to be out alone. Having said this, there are a few quite nice restaurants within a 15 minute walk, especially Joseph's (check out reviews for this). In essence, go here if you have to for a conference or other work-related reason, but look elsewhere for a leisure break.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a night or two!”
Reviews.Author: venicefan
Reviews.Content: My friend & I stayed here as part of a coach tour (Cosmos Tourama) in the summer. Average hotel - I wouldn't really have rated it 4 star - 2 or 3 more likely. Room comfortable, in a reasonably quiet location just outside the city centre. Needed to get public transport/taxi into Rome however. We didn't have breakfast on the first morning, however. I believe that was our tour guide's fault as we didn't have an alarm call. We did have breakfast on the second morning, but it was a little disappointing - little choice of eats. Stayed in June 2000. Rather earlier than the date range mentioned here, but I believe even older reviews can matter! Venicefan, Swansea

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms but where is the rest?”
Reviews.Author: RPMol
Reviews.Content: I staid in the Ergife for two nights on business. Our event was hosted in the hotel. What struck me most arriving this afternoon is that the surrounding areas aren't very nice. The room I'm staying in (3311) is spacious and reasonably clean but missing style and amenities. No iron or iron board, no kettle, poorly stacked mini bar, and rather than the usual bathroom amenities, there were 4 sachets of shower gel! Trying to order some food, there was no answer from room service and the food (pasta dish) which eventually arrived was incredibly salty. The temperature in the room was cold and the heating was not working. An old style TV with only showed the typical Italian channels (and Euronews) but with extremely poor reception. There also did not appear to be a gym.

Reviews.Title: “If you need a large convention hotel...”
Reviews.Author: LeadingWomen
Reviews.Content: I was at the Ergife for several nights for a 1000+ person conference. The rooms were great, loved wine with lunch, enjoyed sitting in the spacious bright lobby to use the wifi. The catering staff were very careful to prepare the pasta to perfection (which made for a slightly rushed lunch because they waited for conference attendees to all be seated). Breakfast buffet was large and varied. Meeting rooms and conference area very conference friendly. Beautiful outdoor pool. If I had to book a large conference in Rome, I would definitely work with the Ergife. If I were going as a tourist, I'd look for a cozy, B&B with character. By the way, if you walk out to the main street and turn right, there's a gem of a seafood restaurant on the right. A nice break from conference food.

Reviews.Title: “Seminar hotel, food quality terrible”
Reviews.Author: Idiko
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel for a seminar of 3 days. The hotel is located a little bit out of the centre but it takes 10 minutes to the centre with a taxi. The hotel room is average, the food quality was very low, breakfast was poor, lunch and dinner were poor. Service quality at the restaurant is poor, old waiters not smiling and seemed pissed off to serve so many people. I would not reccommend this hotel. Reception was terrible, the room was not ready at 14:00 when I checked in, so they gave me a smaller room.

Reviews.Title: “Rip off hotels”
Reviews.Author: Derek R
Reviews.Content: They claim on the website that the rooms have free internet access but when you get there they charge you for a cable to get the free internet why can't these people be upfront and not pretend that it's free.

Reviews.Title: “horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: lonij
Reviews.Content: the worst breakfast ever !!! i am alrgic to milk and i couldn't find single food for me ...

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a palace!”
Reviews.Author: kris10Paris_France
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 4 nights in october 2011 whilst attending the Women's International Networking conference in the hotel. Things got off to a bad start when they announced they'd cancelled my colleages reservation because her credit card expired at the end of November 2011 - she was not the only one to suffer the receptions sloppy organisation, disgraceful customer service, and just plain bad manners. Breakfast turned up 45mins later than ordered, and stone cold, rooms were not cleaned properly, and the restaurants did not do Italian cuisine any favours. Oh, and don't bother packing your gym kit; the advertised facilities don't exist, despite what it says on their website, and despite the signs in reception. Find somewhere else to stay, you'll not regret it

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice rooms for a large conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelandLearn_11
Reviews.Content: Maybe it was just the luck of being in the renovated new wing of the hotel, but the rooms were very comfortable and huge, with a separate sitting area and a small balcony. All the interior was clearly recently renovated, carpets and walls and furniture looked brand new. The hotel itself is a huge conference facility, booked by large groups. I would not recommend it should you go as a solo traveller or family. In order to make it into the center of Rome, you need to walk for five minutes to a bus stop, which then drops you off at the subway system of Rome (quite reliable and super cheap - 1 Euro!). All in all about 40-45 minutes from hotel door to the colloseum. Service is a bit stressed when large groups are in - reception staff is clearly stretched with the large groups, as is the service staff. Breakfast is plain but fine, as was the rest of the food. Best tip: There is a little pizzeria within ten minutes from the hotel, just off the main street (just a little hole in the wall with a real wood-fired oven and delicious pizza!).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ryanair5749
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nites last week & found the rooms very comfortable. The walls were a little thin, we could hear the TV next door. Breakfast was good. We ate at 2 restaurants within a short 5 minute walk & enjoyed it. We were on a bus tour, so location was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great room ... but the view needs a facelift!”
Reviews.Author: up2nogd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night as part of our 16 day tour of Italy. It was by far one of the cleanest and most contemporary hotels on our journey. The only "hiccup" occurred when we arrived. Apparently the front desk staff reserved a block of rooms for our group (of 30) but did not assigned them. Why it took an hour to get through that process will remain a mystery, but let's just say that a "sorry" from the staff would have gone a LONG way in reducing the frustration. Our room appeared to be in a newly renovated section of the hotel and it was clean, well stocked and had a FABULOUS shower (who doesn't appreciate a rain head shower with LOTS of water pressure!). Our breakfast was okay, not great, but not the worst by any means. We were entertained by watching a "certain family" fill up their buckets and jugs with food and drink from the buffet prior to heading out for their day of adventure. Apparently THEY had no issue with the quality OR the quantity of food offered :) Overall, the experience was great and other than the location (which is no where near the "touristy" area) it is a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice pool”
Reviews.Author: Leafbeach
Reviews.Content: A confortable hotel not too far from subway with a huge pool. Olympic size. Breakfast was ok but nothing special. Room were confortable but do not forget to bring IP cable. Wifi not available in rooms but free internet in the lobby by wifi and free by cable in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Do not eat!”
Reviews.Author: khuzu
Reviews.Content: As a hotel even though it is good quality, food is unbeleivably bad. So stay here but eat outside. By the way, if you need to sea Rome, this is so far away and there is no transfer option oyher then taxi. The good side is the swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated!”
Reviews.Author: divineserrano
Reviews.Content: The Italian reception staff was rude when we asked questions;even if he's overwhelmed by the big number of guests who checked in that day,he shouldn't be.even the waiters were slow in serving our food! Overrated!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the old comments! This hotel has changed a lot.”
Reviews.Author: Luiz_gyn
Reviews.Content: This hotel has undergone extensive renovation, and now both the common parts, ands the apartments. They are very nice! The breakfast is well served, but not very good, is regular. And with little variation, if you are staying several days, is quite complicated. Neighbourhood: Go straight to Via Aurelia, close is maybe less than 200 meters, turn left (southwest)and arrive in good, simple and inexpensive restaurant Benedetto. A few meters ahead on the same side, has a car rental named Maggíore I used this. The hotel is located away from the historic center, you reach by going along the Via Aurelia (northeast). And Rome ... It is a week is very little

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Forgottentraveler
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms with flat screen tv, safe and fridge and balcony. Olympic size pool with bar. Short walk to the main road were there is restaurants and small market. No help from front desk when we wanted to go out for dinner. They didn't speak english, they gave us a map of the area. We had to fend for ourselves. They couldn't suggest anywhere to eat because they wanted us to eat in their restaurant. Stayed here when on our tour of Italy.

Reviews.Title: “So happy we stayed here”
Reviews.Author: butterfli_8
Reviews.Content: Fantastic stay. Large, clean rooms. Free wi-fi in the lobby. Staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The hotel is quite far from the subway station, however you could take a cab for $10 euro and be right at the spanish steps. Definitely recommended and would return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here only if there is no alternative”
Reviews.Author: Ann_Onimme
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this place is that the rooms are OK, clean and quiet. The rest is diabolical - the breakfast is not fit for human consumption - horrible coffee from a machine, stale bread and pastries, no fresh fruit, surly service. Dinner is no better - one night I had no choice but to eat here - bad decision. Nearest Metro station is a 20 minute walk (and there are also good places to eat near the station) and via Aurelia is not exactly charming. Towards the end of the conference that I attended discovered that this hotel deals mostly with conferences and government contracts. I suspect they don't care if their customers never come back.

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel, nice rooms, shame about the staff”
Reviews.Author: LondonRad.
Reviews.Content: Ergife Palace, Rome Overall, it's a good corporate (rather than personal/tourist hotel). It's leagues better in some ways than others (such as Sheraton Parco de Medici). There's free internet which is a huge plus. Olympic size pool. Big restaurant... The restaurant. This is where the issues begin. The menu is VERY limited. It's pretty much all beef/veal. The thing the hotel has got significantly wrong, is the restaurant staff. They are so so very rude. They don't acknowledge mistakes, they shout at you, they have no flexibility and above all, are miserable as sin. When there's big events on, don't expect any care or consideration. The hotel is generally reactive rather than proactive. They'll tell you want you can't do but not what the next option is, e.g. We couldn't go in to the main restaurant as it was blocked off for an event. We got shouted out of there, being told we couldn't come in - but then there was no follow up to say where we COULD go for dinner. As it turned out, they'd set a small room aside for the 'spill over' guests, but no-one advised us of this.  Reception staff - some are good, others are just moody. Great at giving dirty looks! The bar staff outside are nice though and seem to be more engaging with a good sense of customer service.  Be careful with security - one of our colleagues got mugged in the hotel car park. Nothing violent - but in short the story went: fake tourist comes up with map asking for help, two fake well dressed men spring out - flash fake police badges, ask if so called tourist is bothering you, then say there's a lot of counterfeit money in Rome so they want to check passports and cash. The tourist goes first, everything gets handed back. then they check yours while the 'tourist' creates a distraction and they swipe half your cash - handing half back so you don't suspect anything. Hotel staff didn't seem to be too fussed or helpful.  The rooms are nice, showers (wet room style) are great. There's lots of places in walking distance to eat elsewhere, which I'd suggest you do.  Stay here if you want a nice airy big hotel, good pool, decent outdoor bar. Don't stay if you want personal service at a four star standard.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Michelle196904
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. Staff helpful. Breakfast excellent. Not close to city or public transport but reasonably easy to get taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Great room in a large hotel”
Reviews.Author: jillypink
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week as part of a large group with my husband and 20 yr old son. We had a large room with a large queen bed and fold out small double bed. The room was modern and spacious and the marble bathroom was huge. It had a separate toilet and walk in shower with large vanity in between. The room also had a balcony. Breakfast was adequate, especially as they were catering for approx 600 people each day. The hotel was modern and spacious. The location, out of the centre of Rome did not bother us as we went out by bus every day but probably would not stay here if did not have transport. Great hotel for groups.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, but too far from Rome centre”
Reviews.Author: SminchyMum
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when I was attending a conference in Rome city centre (drawn by the pool as we had a toddler in tow). The hotel is fine - our room was lovely (large, airy, clean, modern) , as is the lobbby. But it was way too far out from the centre so we moved hotels (no refund from the Ergife as we'd booked in advance through the conference). The hotel www is misleading in terms of how quickly you can get into the centre. Nearest metro station is 15 mins walk away -- 20 minutes with toddler -- and overall the journey in is at least 40 minutes if you're lucky enough to be going somewhere near a station on that tube line, and up to an hour and a half for anywhere else (our journey in took us 75 minutes). Taxis are quicker but still take at least 20 minutes. They cost about 15 euros into the city centre (more after 10pm). Irkesome things included the fact that the pools (BOTH toddler and adult) were freezing and shut at 7pm which is crazy.... and that there was no information about the hotel or environs in the room ... we only knew about free internet If you take your own ethernet cable because we'd read another review. Hotel is in a nondescript suburb with not much going on. Worryingly there were virtually no other guests which was rather spooky... Suspect this is fine to stay in if you are Roman and attending a conference locally. Otherwise head for the city centre. We moved to Grand Hotel Palatino which was great (but even on the 'best floor' - which we were on - had paper thin walls). Breakfast was very nice and served by very friendly staff who provided a high chair for my son whithout me having to ask. The hotel also provided a travel cot for him which was great.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: mimax2
Reviews.Content: good hotel for conference, meeting etc. The hotel offers free access to internet but you should have your own cable to connect your laptop with internet.

Reviews.Title: “Form meets function”
Reviews.Author: TripperGal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for part of the week along with a large, international conference group. About a 25 minute ride from the airport, in a suburban area of Rome. Certainly nothing on the outside grabs you - very 70's slab/drab exterior, with some nice gardens and an Olympic-sized pool, which was not yet open for the season. Too bad, because this hotel, which caters to the conference crowd, could certainly benefit from the installation of some gym facilities. The foyer and multi-level bar/seating area are vast, clean and modern spaces - not unlike an airport terminal. Surely there is enough (wasted) space to accommodate a rec centre, and with the number of conferences going on (at least 3 while I was there), I think the hotel is missing an opportunity to cater to a captive audience. Captive in the sense that one must walk at least 15 minutes to the nearest Metro station to get to the centre of town, or cab it, for something to do. But then again, it is meant to be a functional, efficient conference centre - which it is. Staff is generally helpful and efficient; the meals and service are good; the rooms are spacious enough (though there is no doubt about what goes on in your neighbour's room...). Each room has its own balcony, overlooking - nothing in particular. Conference set up met the standard. The hosted dinner event was excellent, as was the dinner. Overall no real issues or complaints. And yet, this is not where I would want to spend my leisure time. There are some decent restaurants a short walk away, but nothing else in the area to draw one's interest. And one can only spend so much time examining so many leather handbags in the small hotel shop, and wonder how the clerk can smilingly spend 15 hours a day not going mad from nothing to do. Veni, vidi, vici...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl8710
Reviews.Content: Before leaving on our Trafalgar vacation, I read the reviews for the Ergife Hotel on this website and others and was terrified that my experience would be as horrible as other posts suggest. However, I was pleasantly surprised upon arriving at the Ergife Hotel. The lobby and bar area were amazing, and the bedrooms were beautiful! Very modern and comfortable. As for the noise level between rooms, I agree the walls were thin; however, with over 600 rooms, I think one could request a room away from others.

Reviews.Title: “Good conference hotel but not for pleasure”
Reviews.Author: davbentley
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference here and I have to say that the conference lunches were good quality, including good wines. Coped reasonably well with about 400 attendees. My room was good also - modern, clean, excellent shower room. Breakfasts were Ok - you could get bacon and scrambled egg, plus the inevitable italian ham and cheese. Fruit, cereal, croissants, toast etc Some things spoiled it. Before and after the conference the hotel was deserted. Wiser attendees than me had switched to city centre hotels for post-conference leisure. Saturday night, only 5 in for dinner. By far the worst feature was the poor service in the Atrium bar. Waiters hiding away and service poor (and when hotel was quiet I'm not sure if it was manned - it was a mystery -"The Case of the Missing Bar Man"). Bottle of italian beer 4 euros. Second worst feature was the location. You could get a bus to the metro or walk there in 15-30 minutes depending on fitness but I was not too happy about walk back in dark. Once on metro easy access to Vatican, Spanish Steps and Trevi fountain. For Colliseum, metro to Termini then switch lines for 2 stations only PS Late on trip found good restaurant/pizza house - go to top of street, turn left and it's a short distance on the opposite side of the road. Proprieter provides friendly service, interesting customers include locals and family groups. I wouldn't choose this hotel for an italian holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Transformation!”
Reviews.Author: CDEPLANNER
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel from for three nights during our final planning meeting in preparations for a conference we will hold in the Ergife in November. The hotel has been completely transformed into a modern day, clean hotel. I was in a superior room that was spacious, comfortable and very clean. It was tastefully decorated. Five of my colleagues also stayed in the hotel and found their guestrooms to be the same as mine. Public areas were equally as nice to include our meeting room. We were impressed, particularly with the new entrance (this was still under construction when we did our site survey in January.). The staff was friendly; however, not always efficient. Lunches were excellent; however, the breakfast was nothing remarkable. I was told by my Italian colleague that what we saw in this hotel was standard in most. Overall, I would recommend this hotel, especially for business. The location is good being close to a few pizzerias and tratorias and within walking distance of the metro...approx. 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “slice of modern rome”
Reviews.Author: JuneHawaii
Reviews.Content: Rome for many is 500 year old buildings and boutique shops. The Ergife is a part of modern,& also a very real Rome. Modern hotel, with clean rooms and modern bathrooms. And a gorgeous large pool! Located On a side street off Via Aurelia, you can see how Romans live an every day life. Chinese restaurant ( good food ) on the corner, bars, pharmacy, market stall f(mercado) for daily shopping all within 5-10 minute walk. To city center, clear info by the Front Desk to take a bus and metro. To Vatican City---20 minutes No complaints on this place

Reviews.Title: “Congratulations on the renovations!”
Reviews.Author: jjdOttawa
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from an 8 night stay at the Ergife hotel in Rome. We organised an international conference there. I have to say that having read some pretty bad reviews on this site, I was apprehensive beforehand. Let me confirm that the now fully renovated hotel has excellent facilities. All of the rooms were brand new, clean and very comfortable. The food and service was superb. The pool is amazing, and the conference rooms were perfectly suited to any size delegation. Metro and bus are nearby. I would go back in a flash.

Reviews.Title: “Jekyll and Hyde”
Reviews.Author: Louandflo66
Reviews.Content: Six old friends on a Trafalgar tour together - a hellish way to begin! After reading some reviews before we left, we were assured that our tour would not be staying in the "non-renovated" sectin of the hotel. Wrong! When we arrived in the early afternoon and were given our keys - yes indeed, we went through the beautiful foyer to a dark corridor with exposed wires to small dark rooms that were totally unacceptable. Some of the molding was even off with the nails exposed. After showing my e-mail about only using the new rooms,and having calls to London and Rome (proper) , three hours later we were given the new rooms. The difference was amazing. This is NOT a place you want to stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel imaginable”
Reviews.Author: Carol58a
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks fantastic from the foyer. If you are staying at this hotel with a Trafalgar tour - then you are in for a rude shock. You go through this beautiful foyer through a secret door into the old part of the hotel. It actually looks like a really old hospital. The rooms are tiny as are the beds. Be careful if you roll over in the night - you may roll out of your bed. I came out in a massive rash, which i still believe was bed bugs. It was all red with huge welts like bites. I was covered from head to toe. When I called for medical assistance the front desk said they could help, and nobody showed up. This hotel is also a fair way out of Rome, so you have to catch 2 trains to get to the Colesseum and 1 to the Spanish steps. I would never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Horror Movie Setting”
Reviews.Author: ladybird_van
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with Trafalgar tour in August. 2008. The rooms were terrible, smelly and rotten. Small make-up items "magically" disappeared from the room after cleaning. The corridor was dark, long and looked like a place for horror movies setting. Shame on Trafalgar for using such hotel for their groups. I would never use Trafalgar again as I can't trust them after being in such terrible place.

Reviews.Title: “No problems at Ergife”
Reviews.Author: mellocaramel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ergife in July 2008 as part of a tour of Italy with Air Transat. Everyone in our group was in a renovated room which was average size for Europe, a comfortable bed and nice bathroom. Our room had a view of the pool. There was a gentleman singing songs in English and Italian in the evenings by the pool. Breakfast consisted of ham and cheese slices, buns, either peaches and nectarines or fruit salad, cereal and yogurt. This hotel is a little far from many attractions however it was not hard to get to it on the metro. Overall it was a very good stay at the Ergife and this hotel was one of the better ones on the tour.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as I thought it would be”
Reviews.Author: carmandan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel,on the 15th and 16th of June 2008,we had read all the reviews and were prepared for the worst.after we arrived we were surprised to find that our room was fine,small but good. The staff at the hotel were great and treated us very well

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect too much”
Reviews.Author: tb1travels
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel with a Trafalgar Tour and just like the rest of the reviews - I noticed this hotel was antiquated. Luckily we stayed in the "modern" wing. At least the A/C worked well!! The pool was large and refreshing and we sat outside at night and enjoyed (well with a few drinks) the music. The reason we stayed at the hotel at night, is there are no good bars or restaurants around. The worst part is the bus to the underground takes forever!!! And so after waiting about 20 minutes, I took the 20 minute walk to the train station. And did I mention... our tour guide warned us about the break-ins and thefts that the hotel has had because the thiefs know that this hotel is for large tour groups? If you are not a part of a tour group, do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: CukiAtlanta_Georgia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ergife Palace as part of a Trafalgar trip in May. It is not the greatest hotel mainly because the rooms are so very small but it is also not the worst. It helped that I had read previous reviews on this website and knew what to expect. The hotel lobby is very beautiful and modern. The hotel rooms that Trafalgar guests are assigned to are very old and extremely small. However, the beds were reasonably comfortable and since we were only staying for one night it wasn't a great disappointment to me. I would have been very disappointed to stay in this hotel if I was staying in Rome for a week.not just because the room is so cramped but because it is really not close to the main attractions in Rome. We had a drink at the lobby bar and had no trouble getting service there. The drinks were extremely expensive but with the dollar being what it is I expected as much. The hotel is located in a suburb and there is at least one pizza restaurant nearby although we opted to have dinner in Rome with our group. If you are a Trafalgar customer and are staying here prepare yourself for the shock of such a small room. If you are booking this room outside of a tour group, I cannot recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Surprise”
Reviews.Author: JCSBrazil
Reviews.Content: Ergife Hotel is a terrible experience if you want to visit Rome. The hall was very beautiful and nice. We checked in and they told us that to access our room we should walk until the end of the lobby and pass one door. We did it and after this door things started to get bad. Looked like a old hospital. Walked until find the lift, old and poor manteinance. Arriving to our floor it was dark, old, with bad smell. The room was terrible, very small, with bad smell too. Don`t go to this hotel. It`s far from the city center, far from the subway station, about 15 minutes walking. If you take a taxi will spend EURO 15-20 to reach main attractions in ROME. With this value per day, or each ride, you may find a better hotel, closer to a subway station or city center. If you really want to stay in this part of the city I reccomend CLAR Hotel, few steps from Ergife, with renewed rooms. Don`t go to Princess, besides Ergife, is as bad as Ergife.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at the Ergife”
Reviews.Author: e_maccaglia
Reviews.Content: This is a terrible place to stay. We read bad reviews on the internet and contacted our travel agent with our concerns. She said she would check with her Trafalgar Tours representative and let us know. When she called back she said the hotel was remodeled and that we should have not concerns. Trafalgar Tours reassured her. When we arrived at the Ergife, we were delight to see a very nice lobby. When we were taken to our rooms, we were lead through the remodeled section of rooms and we thought, "this is great.:" To our dismay, we were lead to the end of the hallway and told to turn left, only to enter into a dark, dank, smelly room. The room had barely enough room to move around or to place your suitcases. At the bottom of the beds there was only enough room for one person to get through. Your luggage had to be lugged to the bed to be reopened for everything you needed. Not a good place to stay unless your agent books you in the remodeled rooms. To our dismay, the desk clerk said, "Sorry, this is what Trafalgar Tours books for you. There is nothing we can do. Speak with Trafalgar."

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but for the location.”
Reviews.Author: Martez
Reviews.Content: About one third (300?) of the rooms are under renovation. One third are waiting for renovation. One third are newly renovated. It´s very important to get the last mentioned (Which was the case for our group of 39) The one´s I asked was satisfied with their rooms. Our room, and most, had a balcony, no noise, equipment and size normal for a 4-star in Rome. (Including flatscreen) The lobby is very elegant and big. Staff serviceminded above standard for Rome. Breakfast the most tasty we had, in our tour including 8 hotels. And served in a spacy, light and beautiful hall. (Or, more right, in many different halls.) The one and big advantage with Ergife is the location. It´s not inside walking-distance from centre. And it´s 16-17 min from Metro. But if You see it from the bright side: You have no noisy traffic around, and the taxi cost just 10€. The 3 days we stayed, there was always cabs in front of the entrance. PS. I fully understand the one´s who not had known the importance of ordering a renovated room, and therefore became dissatisfied. (Who could know before?)

Reviews.Title: “Believe the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: hamilton2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights as part of a Transat holidays group tour. I read all the bad reviews before going and found them all to be accurate. Our first room had a bare bed leaning against the wall, so we asked for another room and received a damp, dank room in a dark corridor. The dampness permanently wrinkled everything in our suitcase. European hotels aren't big on irons, so we had to live with it. Everyone in our group had a hot fridge that didn't work, and a TV that didn't work. No fire alarms to be found, either. The pool is lovely but they wanted $10 Euros each, and were rude about it. When we asked for a taxi, the lady at the desk said to look outside for one; we said we had just done so, but she didn't believe us and sent a bell boy to check. Then with a huffy attitude she ordered us a taxi. The lobby bar is open at the crack of dawn, but never in the afternoon or evenings when it would be convenient. The Ergife was the joke of our tour; all 20+ people laughed about our stay there for the rest of the trip. It made every other hotel seem that much better.

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated, very modern”
Reviews.Author: lilmissjen
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel as part of our Trafalgar Tour and were pleasantly surprised. Although very tired looking from the outside, the room we had was newly renovated and very nice! The overall style of the hotel is quite modern and the room includes an LCD TV and brand new furnishings and marble bathroom. A big plus is also the Olympic sized swimming pool and tennis court. Breakfast was quite extensive with cereal, croissants, bacon, eggs, fruit salad, etc. Not sure how much it is to stay here as it was part of our tour, but its worth at least 4 stars. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated Rooms, very clean”
Reviews.Author: charleston1
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights, July 16 & 17, 2007. Driving up to the hotel, it did not look good - there is a round, rundown security guard house that was empty that gives a very bad first impression (no one was in it). Walking in, the lobby is very modern and clean. There is a good gift shop with a variety of souveniers from all over Italy on the main level behind the bar. The rooms well small, were very recently renovated and very well appointments - flat screen t.v.s., very nicely appointed bathroom with high qualify fixtures and very clean. Breakfast was fair, did not eat any other meals at hotel. It was a 10 or 15 minute walk to the subway. However, one group on on our tour got stuck in an UNrenovated room and it was awful. Make sure you get a renovated room, and it is fine.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel, don't believe all the negative comments”
Reviews.Author: globewanderer1
Reviews.Content: Before we arrived at this hotel I read up on it on the internet. I heard all sorts of negative reviews and horror stories that the hotel was in a bad state. Instead we were pleasantly surprised to find out the opposite. Our room was modern, with a new bathroom, 2 queen beds with a flat screen tv appended to the wall. On top of that there was a great view from the balcony. Although the hotel is in the northwest part of the city, we were able to get around. At night, we had to take a cab from downtown back to the hotel that cost about 15 Euro. Compared to some of the other hotels we've been in, this hotel was pretty good. Even had a swimming pool too. The breakfast was basic with the usual egg, ham, cheese sort of thing. There's also a souvenir shop on the main floor that sells a few things that may be of interest. Though staff seem a little on the indifferent side (i.e. perhaps not as attentive as north american staff might be), that didn't really affect our visit. Overall, an excellent stay!!! AAA+++

Reviews.Title: “Big Confusing Place”
Reviews.Author: VenusSurf
Reviews.Content: I stayed here, and this place was nuts. The front desk was a nightmare, the rooms were OK, but the elevators sucked. The pool was really large, and what made the stay bearable was the bar by the pool and the crazy one man show at night.

Reviews.Title: “Miserable”
Reviews.Author: Chach
Reviews.Content: We had to find a last minute room in Rome and wound up here. It was miserable for so many reasons. Broken elevators, bad food, nasty smelling rooms, confusing customer service and more! Just don't ever stay there....no matter what! It was one of the longest nights of my life. But my husband and I have a good laugh when we bring it up.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Expect Too Much”
Reviews.Author: Dbpaf
Reviews.Content: When I consider that, in my opinion, Rome was the dirtiest, nastiest city we visited on our trip, the hotel was not a disappointment - merely par-for-the-course. The lobby is deceptively clean and modern. However, the rooms are small and smelly. During our two day stay, the hallways routinely smelled of smoldering electrical fire. Our room routinely smelled of a cross between sewer and dead flesh. No kidding. Once we spent time in our room, we got used to the smell. The bathroom was relatively clean, but again, had an eminating nasty smell. While others complain about the towels, we liked them - then on the morning we were leaving, we found remnants of a former guest's nasal discharge (we call them "boogers") on one of the unused hand towels. The wallpaper was falling off the walls - not just lifting at the seams - falling off the walls! Geez - don't have glue in Italy? On a more positive note, we felt the breakfast was very good - lots of variety. No pancakes, cooked eggs, or bacon - but you're not at your local IHOP here. We had dinner at the hotel's restaurant. The food was good - we had ravioli. In addition to menu items, they had a neat buffet with lots of interesting items. The waiters were a little stiff at first, but then we stared attempting to speak Italian and they loosened up a little. Never overly friendly, but certainly decent. The air conditioning worked our entire stay - but don't expect A/C like your used to. Not as cold, but better than nothing considering it was over 100F outside. No, this is certainly not a "palace". But for two nights, it's adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Ergife " The Terrible" Stay Away!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Grisel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ergife July 20th thru 22 because our tour company put us there and we had no other choice. The rooms are small, the bed crumbles and the bathroom are small with towels of no thicker than a tablecloth. I couldn't believe when my wife told me that these were the towels. One of the elevators was out of service and one day a girl got stuck in this elevator. This hotel is the worse I have ever stayed ever. They said they were renovating other parts of the hotel but we stayed in block 4 which is the worse. If booking on your own ask question what part of the hotel you will be lodging. The only good thing about the hotel is that is 5 minutes from the Vatican and one bus connection to the Metro line but is not worth it staying there believe me. Julio Miami, Florida

Reviews.Title: “Small crummy rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel. The lobby is spacious but it's all downhill from there. The rooms are small --- like a closet -- my roommate and I were tripping over each other and each other's suitcases. The staff at reception was surly. One good thing --- the pool is HUGE and was a God-send after a long day of tripping through Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Major Renovation must have taken place”
Reviews.Author: koser5
Reviews.Content: Our flight back to the states was cancelled so the airline put up 200 people at this hotel. The initial impression of the lobby was absolutely awesome. A BEAUTIFUL huge lobbly magnificently furnished. We were efficiently registered into rooms -- and found we were assigned to beautiful newly remodeled rooms. The modern furnishings were tasefully done--lovely draperies covering a wall of windows--a suite type arrangement with chair, sofa and desk in one area. The bathroom was extraordinary with a separate walk-in shower. The accommodations were the topic of conversation with our fellow passengers, with some comments of wanting to go home and remodel bathrooms to resemble these! The previous comments about this hotel seem totally incongruous to what we experienced--obviously some major renovations were made. They have changed what must have been an awful experience to stay there to one that is very wonderful. Beautiful pool and outside lounge area, filled with flowering bushes.

Reviews.Title: “Give this hotel a miss!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had this hotel booked for us as part of a tour,the foyer and bar area looks impressive,but thats where it stops. The lifts are quite a distance from foyer down a long corridor which reminded me of a hospital,once you get in the rooms with two suitcases you stop!! the rooms are tiny compared with other 4 star hotels we stayed in around italy,the towels are a poor excuse. We had security problems with one of the porters,we discovered 300 euros missing from my wifes purse the following morning once we had left the hotel and went to pay the cab driver,the couple next door to us on the same floor had the door key taken whilst they were taking their cases in (by the same porter) and of course they deny any wrong doing, i will never go back there - even if they pay me!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here, horrible hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It's the worst hotel I've ever stayed. We were on a tour and they picked this hotel. The service is horrible, the rooms were small and disgusting, even the towels were like kitchen towels. The breakfast was poor and they closed it before the time it was supposed to close. The bathroom was horrible, the shower sprayed water everywhere but to you. They had some areas that looked nice but they put us all in the poor area, looks like a motel rather than a four star hotel. Just don't stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If Only I Have Listened!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Before booking at this hotel they called Ergife Palace Hotel i had read the reviews of the former guests of the hotel. Most of them had negative comments ranging from the ammenities to the services. But still is dont listen ( a fault of mine perhaps). Coz i was thinking then that since what i need is only a place to sleep at night and that i dont have enough time to look for another available hotel (coz i'm not lucky enough looking after 3 hotels for there's no vacancy) so i thought that this would be okay. so there i was staying at the hotel from 21 november to 25. i then realized that THEY were not telling lies but rather a clear and vivid detail of the hotel! WOW, everything's TRUE! maybe i can take the amenities of the hotel but what i can not accept is the services of their staffs. they were so rude and discorteous! well, for people planning of staying in rome, be sure not to go into this hotel 'coz you might end up like me!

Reviews.Title: “Conference”
Reviews.Author: chaai
Reviews.Content: Stay at the Ergife for a whole week for a Conference. Hotel is not conveniently located. Pool is empty as there's no guard. Attitude of the staff is terrible, as others have described. They don't care about you on the other side of the counter: it seems they don't like to serve. It's a 1,000 room conference hotel WITHOUT any business center, nor power points in the room for laptops, least internet point. You have to pay for the so called FREE shuttle service; quality of the food served in the hotel is lousy and you don't need to have your meals there. I found a lot of good eateries around, although one has to walk a little bit.

Reviews.Title: “very terrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed 6 days in this hotel. they promised us a 4star hotel but it was hardly a 2star hotel. the air conditioning system didn't work. rooms was very hot. towels was dirty and small. decoration was old. water remained on the bath floor after showering. the television was small screen and there were no pay tv. carpeting was dirty and used. lifts was very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting Dirty Dump”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have read some quasi-kind reviews on this hotel which totally baffles me. There is NOTHING good about this hotel. The staff are rude with a major attitude. They stuff you in smelly, dark, dirty, old rooms. If you have stayed in as many hotels as I have for business travel and otherwise, you would know this is absolutely unacceptable. They forget they are in the business of hospitality. Not cheap either, paid $200 CAD, aprx 130 Euros. The location is horrible, it's in a suburb type area far from anything, where the local businesses hate tourists. There are some restaurants underneath some apartment buildings, but the food is not fresh and is over-priced for tourists, as there are 3-4 hotels nearby. Night is seedy, don't walk around. I stayed there as a result of a Trafalgar Tour. I'm disgusted this tour company could choose such a seedy hotel. The lobby looks good but is misleading, they haven't spent a dollar since the '60s on any renovations in the rooms. Bathroooms a nightmare with tea towels for your bath. Air conditioning is routinely turned off. Too bad if your room faces some dump construction site. Out of a 1000 rooms, some look newer which may account for some kinder postings but is still unforgivable that they would give tour company tourists such sub-standard rooms. I had to stay 2 extra days and after freaking out at the smell and the toilet that didn't flush and the intervention of my tour guide, I got a more decent room. However, that should be the norm, one shouldn't have to freak out to get a decent room. Someone should find a way to shut this dump down. No one there cares about the lack of customer service. Stay away. Free breakfast is a joke - cold hard boiled eggs and melba toast in a package. You have to PAY to use the pool - unheard of considering this is not a cheap hotel. This hotel is so awful, I didn't sully my digital camera with pictures of it. Only way this dump stays in business is that tour companies routinely book 45-50 guests weekly there. Complain to your tour company and maybe one day they will lose the business. I won't say this hotel ruined my trip, by was not a great intro to Italy and started and ended it on a very depressing note. If you can - find any other place to stay. No hotel was as bad as this in the half dozen hotels I stayed in Italy on my tour. Trust me - this place is BAD NEWS.

Reviews.Title: “Nowhere near as bad as other reviews indicate”
Reviews.Author: brian14leonard
Reviews.Content: My goddaughter and I stayed here for two nights in early June as part of a Trafalgar tour, and I thought it was one of the better hotels on our trip. Sure, there were some little faults, and like most of the hotels we stayed in there was no air conditioning (or it wasn't working), but overall it was fine. The highlight, as some others have mentioned, was the incredibly huge swimming pool, which was terrific (and nearly empty when we were in it). Also, there is a very nice large indoor/outdoor bar. And don't believe what others say about the only nearby restaurant being McDonald's: we ate at a wonderful, reasonably-priced Italian restaurant two blocks down from the hotel; their bistecca alla Fiorentina was only surpassed by the one I had in Florence.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay at the Ergife”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Terrible hotel, I would never recommend this place to anyone ever, poor quality...dirty antiquated rooms. Total lack of customer service. Poor location....elevators don't work, no guest services. Rooms are substandard. Stay away from this tourist trap...enjoy Rome somewhere else...

Reviews.Title: “Terrible; a nightmare”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had seen bad news about the hotel, but I could never imagined how bad it could be. The rooms were very old, dirty carpet, the air conditioning worked only few hours a day (could you imagine, at 11:30pm it was switched off, and we suffered a lot, as it was very hot in this time of the year). The fawcetts were dripping all the night, and the smell was very unpleasant. The continental breakfast was terrible; few options, bad service, not very clean. If you can avoid, don't go there!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay at the Rome Egife Palace Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel. Groups should avoid the Rome Egife Palace Hotel like the plague. I was with a group of military members over the weekend, 52 of us. We were treated horribly, this hotel does not offer customer service. Its a tourist mill and all they care about is making money. The rooms are substandard and not 4 star quality, wallpaper falling off the wall, stains on the walls, no floor overing, wires hanging from the ceiling, rotary phones, no hairdryers, no mini bar, dirty...no floor coverings. Hotel charges guests 6 Euro to use the pool...9 Euro for a Rum and Coke etc, etc. Most of all its the poor customer service...lack of willingness to help the guests. The management made it clear they didn't like Americans...they only liked our money. Lastly the location of the hotel is not good. Its outside of Rome, a long walk to the metro...nearest restaurant is McDonalds, just what one wants to eat in Rome. The hotel charges for a shuttle to the city but is only available in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you need a place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: ovaltinemaster
Reviews.Content: This hotel was included with the tour I was with. Compared to some other hotels we were put in, this hotel was definitely not the worst, but it was also not the best. Hotel Lobby: A large and spacious lobby with a comfortable and modern feeling. Olympic Size Swimming Pool: Shocked to find it at a hotel like this, definitely the highlight of the hotel. Rooms: Hallways were old and creepy, definitely a shock to see after seeing the nice lobby. The rooms are equally old and a bit dirty looking. The balcony was nice, but that wasn't enough to cover the old looking room with the old looking bed with the ancient TV. Bathrooms: Were functional, and had the necessities. The shower head gave us a great trickle of water, perfect if you like washing your hair 10 strands at a time. I believe the toilet flushed water stronger than the shower did. Otherwise the bathroom was alright. Breakfast: Was alright, with the bare essentials in a breakfast, if you need something to hold you over until lunch, this works. Hotel Desk Staff: Decent by Italian hotel standards = rude but not to the point where they make you cry. Expect to memorize the street of Rome, or shell out bucks to buy a map, because a free map was out of the question, as well as adequate instructions to the centre of Rome. Location: Far from the Centre, but close to a Metro station: 15 min walk, and a bit seedy at night. Overall, a decent place to stay if all you want is a place to sleep, otherwise, not a pretty place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great entryway, leaves a lot to be desired”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at this hotel as part of our tour package. Prior to getting to Rome, we stayed at an absolutely horrible hotel, so I wasn't expecting anything great. When the tour bus drove up to the hotel, the place looked like a "Palace". We were so grateful for the pleasant surroundings that it was another full day before we realized the following: The door was difficult to open and lock- could be problematic if there were a fire. The food was ample, but mostly cold and stay away from the fruit. It was not fresh at all. The bathroom towels were thin as toilet paper.

Reviews.Title: “It's a little like a train station ...”
Reviews.Author: adnelg
Reviews.Content: A very large and rather impersonal hotel, but fine if what you're planning to do is stay in Rome and see the sights instead of lounging in your hotel. Clean, average sized rooms for a European hotel with larger bathrooms than I am accustomed to when traveling. Helpful front desk staff. Internet available for about 3 euros/half hour. About a 10 minute walk from the nearest subway stop (but this really isn't too bad considering that Rome is a HUGE city with only two subway lines).

Reviews.Title: “A perfectly fine hotel if you don't have an "ugly American" attitude!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you go to this hotel with high expectations, you may be disappointed ... but I truly felt the amenities were adequate and the staff were quite helpful and pleasant. The reviews on this site truly scared me before I went with 2 friends for Thanksgiving 2004, so my expectations were indeed quite low. The lobby and bar areas are actually very modern and nice, but the rooms are small and could use some renovation. It appeared they were starting to do some modernization of the hotel on the lower floors when we were there. The nearest metro station is probably a 10-15 minute walk (maybe 1.5 miles away), but taxis are always available or the staff will call one for you. It cost us about 12 euros (approx. $15) one way to get to the Spanish Steps. The Vatican is the probably the closest main attraction (maybe a 10 minute drive). There were lots of nuns staying in the hotel while we were there. Overall, I had no complaints about this hotel and the neighborhood is not "seedy" as some have suggested here. It's certainly not Beverly Hills ... but if you can relax your heightened expectations, you might find your trip to Rome enjoyable. Our attitude was "we just need someplace clean to shower and get some rest before heading to the tourist sites and the local clubs!" Continental breakfast is offered too ... a great treat when you get in from the club at 7 in the morning, while passing the nuns in the lobby ... ha, ha.

Reviews.Title: “It's a Dump!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this so-called 4* hotel back in late September 2001 (yes, a week after 9/11/01) and found this to be one of the worst hotels we have ever stayed in. It basically compares to a sub-par Motel 6 back in the States. The rooms and bathroom were terrible. And the staff was perhaps the rudest we have ever encountered. I really can’t say anything positive about the hotel. The location was too far from the major sites and the nearest restaurant outside the hotel was about a 10 minute walk. About the only thing I can say is, fortunately, we did not get robbed. The location was quite seedy. In a word, the hotel is a dump!

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the bad press”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for... Unlike other reviewers, we thought the hotel was a good value for the money. Part of a Gate1travel package. Would pay no more than 70 euros a night. Located in a quiet area. Rooms semi-quiet. Front desk helpful... Let them see that you will be giving them a few euros and see how cooperative they can be. Rooms are clean and functional. A well kept - old Holiday Inn, big with clergy visiting the Vatican and convention groups. Hotel is a 10 euro cab ride away from everything, but a cab is always waiting. Hotel has a shuttle to Vatican City and Airport - reasonable. Didn't try the food at the hotel. There were a few places within walking distance to find basic food. Didn't use the Metro - Not a glamor spot, but a clean, safe place to rest your head.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Terrible Terrible++”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It might be better than some guest houses, but if you expect a 4-star hotel, it is just terrible. No matter the quality of the room or the service, no other word can be used to discribe it. The only thing it is related to 4-star is the price. The room, especially the restroom, is worser than the motels I've stayed in US. It is not only small but old and dirty. You will believe what I said if you really go there. If you want to go to Rome and have the money to book this hotel, I would suggest you save yourself some money to go shopping.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Contrary to most of the other reviews, I found my stay at Ergife to be very pleasurable. The lobby was beautiful, the staff phenomenal, and the meals acceptable. Some updates in the room would have been nice, but it was definitely a comfortable environment. I would not hesitate to return although I would bring some comfortable walking shoes next time for the hike to the metro station.

HotelInfo.Name: Ergife Palace Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Aurelia 617-619, 00165 Rome, Italy
